p: The P. malayana plant was acquired from Cermin Nan Gedang in the district of Sarolangun, Jambi, Indonesia, and defined by a botanist, Shamsul Khamis. The plant sample was deposited at the KOP Herbarium, IIUM, Kuantan, for authentication. For seven days, the leaves were dried at ambient temperature and then powdered utilizing a universal cutting mill bought from Fritsch, Germany. The powdered plant leaves were preserved at −80 °C before extraction [ 22, 31].
